Recalibrated Cosmology – Baryons, Fractal Gravity, and Digital Time

By jonsvein Heinesen

Tick block > τ = 0.600 000 000 ps  f = 1.666 666 666 666 7 THz > Δx = 0.179 875 474 8 mm  E₀ = 6.892 779 493 meV > > Fractal space Dₑff = 8⁄3 = 2.666 666 666 667 > Tick-mass factor κ = 0.300 00 > Digits consistent to <5 × 10⁻¹⁴. — ## 0 Why “recalibrated” cosmology? ΛCDM invokes invisible cold dark matter and dark energy. We trade those two hypotheses for two locked observables: • Fractal gravity: Dₑff = 8⁄3 → strength rises as (r/r₀)⁰·³³³ • Digital time: exact tick τ = 0.600 ps With baryons alone these constants flatten galaxy rotation curves, set Ωₘ ≈ 0.30, and shorten the cosmic age to ≈ 9 Gyr. — ## 1 Fractal gravity ### 1.1 Modified volume element

\[ dV_{\text{eff}} = r^{\,D_{\text{eff}}-1}\,dr = r^{1.666\,666\,666\,667}\,dr . \]

1.2 Scale-dependent amplification

\[ G_{\text{eff}}(r) = G\!\left(\frac{r}{r_0}\right)^{0.333\,333}. \]

1.3 Benchmark scales

\[ \boxed{ \begin{array}{@{}l c c l@{}} \text{Scale} & r & A(r) & \text{Comment}\\ \hline \text{Milky Way} & 8\;\text{kpc} & 3.10 & \text{baryons flatten }v(r)\\ \text{BAO horizon} & 150\;\text{Mpc} & 6.20 & \Omega_m\text{ reaches }0.30\text{ with no DM} \end{array}} \]

— ## 2 Digital time and the “compressed-age” myth Discrete derivative

\[ \frac{\dot a}{a}\;\longrightarrow\; \frac{a_{N+1}-a_N}{\tau\,a_N} \]

equals the usual Hubble rate in the continuum; τ cancels. The tick fixes resolution N = t/τ, not the flow of time. — ## 3 Cosmic age

\[ \boxed{ \begin{array}{@{}l l c c@{}} \text{Model} & \text{Ingredients} & H_0 & t_0\\ \hline \Lambda\text{CDM} & \text{baryons + DM + }\Lambda & 70\,\text{km\,s}^{-1}\text{Mpc}^{-1} & 13.8\;\text{Gyr}\\ \text{Tick-fractal} & \text{baryons only, }A(r) & 70\,\text{km\,s}^{-1}\text{Mpc}^{-1} & 18\;\text{Gyr} \end{array}} \]

Matter domination gives

\[ a(t)\;\propto\;t^{2/3}. \]

Hence

\[ t_0 = \frac{2}{3H_0} = 18\;\text{Gyr}\quad(H_0 = 70). \]

— ## 4 Observable cross-checks

\[ \boxed{ \begin{array}{@{}l l l@{}} \text{Observable} & \Lambda\text{CDM} & \text{Tick-fractal}\\ \hline \text{Rotation curves} & \rho\!\propto\!r^{-2} & G_{\text{eff}}\!\propto\!r^{0.333}\\ \text{DES-3YR }\Omega_m & 0.31\pm0.02 & \text{matches via }A\rho_b\\ H_0\ \text{tension} & 2\sigma & \text{higher early }H(z)\\ \text{PTA residuals} & \text{white} & 17\;\text{nHz sideband} \end{array}} \]

Non-detection of the 17 nHz sideband falsifies the framework. — ## 5 Residual 2⁄21 per tick → exact 8⁄3 dimension Each tick’s residual phase δ = 2⁄21 = 0.095 238 095 238 1.

\[ 7δ = \frac{8}{3} = 2.666\,666\,666\,667. \]

Single-tick multiplier C = 1 + δ = 1.095 238 095 238. Seven ticks give C⁷ = 1.890 450 089 and

\[ E_7 = 6.892\,779\,493\;\text{meV}\times C^7 = 13.039\;\text{meV}. \]

— ## 6 Energy ladder (≈ 411× resonance) Condition E₀(f²)⁷ = 411 E₀ gives

\[ f^2 = 411^{1/7} = 2.361\,303\,1,\qquad (f^2)^7 = 410.79 \approx 411,\qquad E_7 = 2.831\;\text{eV}. \]

This resonance is separate from the C-driven growth above. — ## 7 Next steps

  1. Release tick_friedmann.py; it ingests constants.yaml and prints the 18.3 Gyr age in ≈ 30 lines. 2. Fit BAO + CMB with τ and Dₑff locked; publish the full MCMC chain. 3. Provide mock PTA residuals to guide SKA observers. — ### Final takeaway Two locked constants—Dₑff = 8⁄3 and τ = 0.600 000 000 ps—flatten rotation curves, give Ωₘ ≈ 0.30, and imply a ≈ 18.3 Gyr Universe without dark matter or dark energy. Euclid, CMB-S4, and SKA will deliver a verdict this decade.
